content.p: Communications made in the application for or in the course of a sexual offender’s diagnosis and treatment in the program between a sexual offender or member of the offender’s family and any employee of the department who is assigned to work in the program, or approved provider, as defined in , shall be privileged from disclosure in any civil or criminal proceeding, other than proceedings to determine the sentence, unless the offender consents in writing to the disclosure or the communication is related to an ongoing criminal investigation. The privilege created by this section shall not extend to disclosures made for the purpose of determining whether the offender should continue to participate in the program. The provisions of shall not apply to a communication made, received, or overheard if the communication is made pursuant to this section. The offender shall be informed in writing of the limits of the privilege created in this section.
